content: My dear friends. I have a question for you all. Please think about it and answer it honestly. Please feel free to comment on why you would donate to either one. When I went to the polls this November to vote I was asked if I wanted to donate to the democratic or republican parties. I said NO because I don't believe in donating money to unworthy causes. However, If they would have said,"would you like to donate to your state or government to build more prisons" I would have gladly donated $50.00 bucks. I feel we are going to need more and more prisons to meet the future needs of this country with the economy the way it is. Seems like more and more illegal aliens, drug users, and gangs are coming out in the open now and since they can't find jobs there is nothing else left for them to do but turn to crime.

content: quote: Originally posted by threerings: quote: Originally posted by SeaWitch1220: quote: Originally posted by Bleah: How about we stop locking up drug users? Seems like simpler (and cheaper) solution. Perfect solution! Maybe you should go live in an area full of them.. Everyone already does "live in an area full of them.." (drug users), whether you realize it or not. The "War on Drugs" is a war against human nature and personal liberty.. it's futile, ignoble, extremely costly and ultimately accomplishes nothing more than jailing nonviolent citizens while enriching criminal gangs, (by driving up the price of drugs). It seems that those hardcore supporters of this quite frankly unAmerican effort have learned absolutely nothing from the failure of Prohibition and the rise of organized crime that it engendered. Drugs need to be legalized and taxed, (treated like alcohol, which is just another drug after all). This would cripple criminal gangs both here and in Mexico.

quote: Originally posted by SeaWitch1220: quote: Originally posted by shades_of_grey: Everyone already does "live in an area full of them.." (drug users), whether you realize it or not. The "War on Drugs" is a war against human nature and personal liberty.. it's futile, ignoble, extremely costly and ultimately accomplishes nothing more than jailing nonviolent citizens while enriching criminal gangs, (by driving up the price of drugs). It seems that those hardcore supporters of this quite frankly unAmerican effort have learned absolutely nothing from the failure of Prohibition and the rise of organized crime that it engendered. Drugs need to be legalized and taxed, (treated like alcohol, which is just another drug after all). This would cripple criminal gangs both here and in Mexico. Safe to say Shades that this is the one thing in the world we agree on.
reply: Yep. I'm conservative but I'm also libertarian, and believe that whatever substances a person chooses to ingest are none of the government's damn business.
